intro: Apeiba hypoleuca, commonly known as the golden apple tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces fleshy, orange-red berries that are edible and contain a single large seed. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitats.
